name: Story Time with Cows - Storytime for Children and Families
description:
Join us for a unique and heartwarming experience! This event is perfect for children and their parents. We`ll start with a visit to a local gaushala, where you`ll have the opportunity to interact with gentle farm animals. Following the gaushala visit, we’ll head to Atta Galatta for a captivating reading of "Vijay Visits a Farm." This beautifully illustrated book will inspire young minds to connect with nature and animals. After the reading, we`ll have a lively kid-friendly discussion about animal welfare and the importance of protecting our environment.
Key Highlights:

Meet at Akhila Karnataka Prani Daya Sangha 
Book reading at Atta Galatta
Engaging discussion
Family-friendly fun
Meet at Akhila Karnataka Prani Daya Sangh @ 9:30am (please arrange transportation to transit to Atta Galatta at 11am) 
You can join just for the storytelling portion directly at Atta Galatta, at 11 AM

name: Introduction to Design Thinking - Workshop
description:
Are you ready to unlock your creative potential and revolutionize the way you approach problems? Design thinking is a human-centered approach that empowers you to empathize with users, ideate innovative solutions, and prototype your ideas rapidly.
In this workshop, you’ll learn:

The five-step design thinking process: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, and Test.
How to apply design thinking to real-world challenges.
Practical tools and techniques for brainstorming and problem-solving.

Join us and discover how design thinking can help you:

Innovate more effectively.
Collaborate with others more productively.
Create solutions that truly meet the needs of your users.

Don’t miss this opportunity to ignite your creativity and drive innovation.
Facilitated by business consultant and corporate trainer Mr. Vishal Mimani

name: Citizen by Descent - Book-Based Session
description:
Discover the heartwarming and insightful world of Citizen by Descent with author Kritika Arya.
Citizen by Descent is a captivating collection of autobiographical essays exploring themes of home, mental health, identity, and the unique experiences of a third-culture kid.
Born in Dubai, educated in the UK, and now living in India, the book chronicles a life in constant motion, searching for roots amidst the journeys. Each essay is brought to life by stunning illustrations from a diverse group of international artists. Through introspective essays set in different homes, the book offers a relatable narrative for those seeking growth and self-discovery.
Kritika Arya is a writer and storyteller with a passion for exploring the human experience. With a master’s degree (MA) in Dramatic Writing and a background in theatre, production and documentaries, she moved to India in 2017 to pursue a career as a writer. Since then, she has written for an award-winning international web series called Bhak, worked on Life in a Day 2020 and is currently part of the team making a global documentary about mental health called I Hope This Helps.

name: Secrets of  Sari Storytelling - Immersive Styling Workshop
description:
Like Bill Waterson-Calvin’s SpaceMan Spiff, if you too nurture an alter ego of becoming a sari storyteller, attend this session. It discusses tips and techniques to refine your sari styling and fashion storytelling. Okay, it does not promise to turn you into a chic sensation overnight, but it can make you mindful of telling your sari style story by managing your fashion image for the world. You can apply the learning to daily life. NOTE: The workshop is for a limited number of participants. We request you to register accordingly. Please carry a sari you love or dislike, your fave journal, and a pen.
OBJECTIVES

To help you express your sari fashion identity in a safe circle of listeners.
To help you know the ground rules of mindful sari styling for SELF.
To help you learn the basics of sari story writing for SELF (read: for social media).

FACILITATOR
The session is conducted by Bhawana Pingali, former Fashion Features Editor of FEMINA (Worldwide Media Ltd.—Times of India / BBC Magazines). She is a mother of a teen, has been an editor-educator for the last 19+ years, and is currently authoring a book with PENGUIN. Her articles have appeared in The Hindu, Hindustan Times-Mint Lounge, Time Out, Lonely Planet, Travel + Leisure, Maxim, Orissa Post, Signature-Oman, among others. She has taught at NIFT, Pearl Academy, Symbiosis Institute of Design, CEPT-Ahmedabad, IIM-A, British Council (TEFL-certified trainer), GD Goenka and Ansal Universities. Her heart now lies in teaching yoga, and reviving saris and rituals through fashion research lab REVASTRA.

name: Mahabharata Stories in Bengaluru - Storytelling
description: The Mahabharata is a living epic that thrives amongst us.  If so, what about Bengaluru? What stories live in this city in the form of art, architecture, rituals, and landscape. Join Aparna Jaishankar for an oral storytelling performance, as she shares a few episodes from the Mahabharata that one might have seen and experienced in the city of Bengaluru.

name: An Evening of Magic - International Edition - Magic Show
description:
Your favourite show – An Evening of Magic – just went International! 
The November edition of this acclaimed magic show presents an amazing ensemble of top magicians and mentalists, led by American magician Joshua Jay and British Illusionist Andi Gladwin, both of whom have performed all over the world and appeared on numerous TV shows, including FOOL US! 
Joshua and Andi are performing for the first time ever in India and will be joined by their friends and top international magicians from across the world and India, including Jeff Kowalk, David Nobo, Raja Moorthy, Pradip Amladi, Prahlad Acharya, and Shankar Junior. This special once-in-a-lifetime edition of ‘An Evening of Magic' will be hosted by the Indian mentalist, Nakul Shenoy.
Come, experience magic at its very best. 
An Evening of Magic is a most amazing magic show presented by `Nakul Shenoy & Friends`, featuring top entertainers and magic acts. Curated and hosted by the internationally-acclaimed mentalist Nakul Shenoy, each event in this series brings unique acts and performances by nationally and internationally acclaimed magicians, alongside some of the most notable up-and-coming stars of magic. This is an evening that is truly magical, and one you will want to experience many times over.

name: Coffee and Conversations - Group Meetup
description:
What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.
We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.
After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!
Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.
Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.
Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.
Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.
Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.
Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.
Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.
Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.
Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: River of Stories - Storytelling for Children and Families
description:
Renu Narayan, Professional Storyteller and Founder of KathaVriksh is a passionate storyteller who believes that stories are for all ages right from the foetus in the womb to a 100 years old person. She curates stories for children, adults and for family audiences. Her storytelling is highly interactive and very enjoyable. She travels to different cities in India to spread the joy of stories. She has also travelled abroad to attend Storytelling conferences and does storytelling for audiences in other countries through Zoom. She was one of the main organisers of the recent Children’s Storytelling Festival at Chennai in August 2024.
A River of Stories is a 60 minutes program wherein she’ll share an eclectic collection of stories meant for both children and adults. She believes stories can bring people together fostering love, understanding and harmony. Through her stories she highlights the importance of love and concern for animals, the environment and for each other.
Whenever the occasion demands it, she uses puppets and other props to make the stories come alive.  She also tells stories using Kamishibai which is the Japanese style of storytelling.
We invite you to attend the session for a fun filled time with family and friends.

name: BeST Festival - Storytelling Festival
description:
Bangalore Storytelling Society (BSS), estd. in 2013, is a not-for-proﬁt collective of Professional Storytellers in Bangalore, who work towards reviving, nurturing and promoting the art of Oral Storytelling in the community and in the contemporary context.
Bengaluru Storytelling Festival (BeSt Festival) is a yearly event that was started by team BSS in the year 2018, with the aim of giving a wholesome story experience for the storylovers of Bengaluru.
This year is the 6th edition of the BeSt fest and we proudly present to you the following events at Atta Galatta:

Story Mania
Tapestry of Tales
Understanding the Special String Puppets of India

name: Story Mania - Storytime for Children as part of BeST Fesival
description:
Do you like to solve puzzles, crack codes, create stories and have super fun all at the same time? Put your thinking hats on and get ready to participate in a high energy, game-filled, OG-level story-based event exclusively put together for all young kids who love stories, games and a whole new level of excitement!
For Children Aged 7-12 Years

name: Understanding the Special String Puppets of India - Learning Capsule on Puppetry and Storytelling
description:
The BeSt Festival Learning Capsule is curated keeping in mind the knowledge seekers of Bengaluru who aim to upskill themselves and delve deeper in to the art of storytelling through unique workshops by eminent storytellers and artists from Karnataka.
This year`s learning capsule is titled " Understanding the Special String Puppets of India". It will be led by the eminent storyteller, Padmashri awardee and the founder director of Dhaatu Puppet Theatre, Smt.Anupama Hoskere from Bengaluru.
This workshop will give you an idea of storytelling through a puppeteer`s lens. Please note that this can be attended by anyone above16 years of age and does not require one to know about puppetry or storytelling as a pre requirement.This will be an experience in itself.
Book your tickets to experience the magic of this unique art form.
Bangalore Storytelling Society (BSS), estd. in 2013, is a not-for-proﬁt collective of Professional Storytellers in Bangalore, who work towards reviving, nurturing and promoting the art of Oral Storytelling in the community and in the contemporary context.
Bengaluru Storytelling Festival ( BeSt Festival) is a yearly event that was started by team BSS in the year 2018, with the aim of giving a wholesome story experience for the storylovers of Bengaluru.
This year is the 6th edition of the BeSt fest and we proudly present to you the learning capsule.

name: Tapestry of Tales - Storytelling
description:
Are we part of our land or is our land part of us? Join Bangalore Storytelling Society for a Tapestry of Tales. This is an evening of oral stories of Professions and Heritage woven together; exploring the rich tapestry of culture, history, and nature.
Celebrating Karnataka’s diversity and heritage in crafts, cuisines, conservation and culture, BSS brings to you a Tapestry of Tales. To weave this beautiful tapestry, we have Vrunda Sekhar, who will give a peek into the world of Ilkal weaves, Monika Manchanda, who will bring in the aroma of food stories in Bangalore, Krithi Karanth, who will give us a glimpse into the world of wildlife conservation and Anil Ravindran, who will take us into the world of Coffee and its aromatic tales.
Do mark your calendar and spend an evening at the cosy Atta Galatta on a Sunday evening traveling our rich landscape.
performer:
Anil Ravindran, 
Bangalore Storytelling Society, 
Krithi Karanth, 
Monika Manchanda, 
Vrunda Sekhar,

name: Mythology Marvels - Children's Day Special - Storytime for Children and Families
description:
Indic Mythology is full of answers to the many whys of our culture. Join Lavanya Prasad and Meenu Sivaramakrishnan, as they explore and bring forth the marvellous stories from the Indic Mythology through music, dance and theatre.
This November, we are celebrating Children. Come and listen to lesser-known tales of the Gods when they were young. Adventures, challenges they faced it all Join us to listen to tales that enthral.
Looking forward to meeting you all!
About the Storytellers:
Lavanya Prasad & Meenu Sivaramakrishnan are passionate professional storytellers with mutual love for Music and Mythology. Mythology Marvels is their humble attempt to bring to light the treasures from Indian mythology (this time from around the world too) to the children and Families of Bengaluru through music, dance and theatre. Both Lavanya and Meenu run their respective storytelling ventures.
Please find more about them here.
Lavanya Prasad : www.talescope.in
Meenu Sivaramakrishnan : www.kathagalatta.com

name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
November Read: Whose Samosa is it Anyway? The Story of Where “Indian” Food Really Came From by Sonal Ved
We assure you that you will relish every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!
